35   def mpmath_check(min_ver):
36       return pytest.mark.skipif(
37           mpmath is None
38           or _pep440.parse(mpmath.__version__) < _pep440.Version(min_ver),
39           reason=f"mpmath version >= {min_ver} required",
40       )

43   class TestCplxPair:
44   
45       def test_trivial_input(self):
46           assert _cplxpair([]).size == 0
47           assert _cplxpair(1) == 1
48   
49       def test_output_order(self):
50           xp_assert_close(_cplxpair([1+1j, 1-1j]), [1-1j, 1+1j])
51   
52           a = [1+1j, 1+1j, 1, 1-1j, 1-1j, 2]
53           b = [1-1j, 1+1j, 1-1j, 1+1j, 1, 2]
54           xp_assert_close(_cplxpair(a), b)
55   
56           # points spaced around the unit circle
57           z = np.exp(2j*pi*array([4, 3, 5, 2, 6, 1, 0])/7)
58           z1 = np.copy(z)
59           np.random.shuffle(z)
60           xp_assert_close(_cplxpair(z), z1)
61           np.random.shuffle(z)
62           xp_assert_close(_cplxpair(z), z1)
63           np.random.shuffle(z)
64           xp_assert_close(_cplxpair(z), z1)
65   
66           # Should be able to pair up all the conjugates
67           x = np.random.rand(10000) + 1j * np.random.rand(10000)
68           y = x.conj()
69           z = np.random.rand(10000)
70           x = np.concatenate((x, y, z))
71           np.random.shuffle(x)
72           c = _cplxpair(x)
73   
74           # Every other element of head should be conjugates:
75           xp_assert_close(c[0:20000:2], np.conj(c[1:20000:2]))
76           # Real parts of head should be in sorted order:
77           xp_assert_close(c[0:20000:2].real, np.sort(c[0:20000:2].real))
78           # Tail should be sorted real numbers:
79           xp_assert_close(c[20000:], np.sort(c[20000:]))
80   
81       def test_real_integer_input(self):
82           xp_assert_equal(_cplxpair([2, 0, 1]), [0, 1, 2])
83   
84       def test_tolerances(self):
85           eps = spacing(1)
86           xp_assert_close(_cplxpair([1j, -1j, 1+1j*eps], tol=2*eps),
87                           [-1j, 1j, 1+1j*eps])
88   
89           # sorting close to 0
90           xp_assert_close(_cplxpair([-eps+1j, +eps-1j]), [-1j, +1j])
91           xp_assert_close(_cplxpair([+eps+1j, -eps-1j]), [-1j, +1j])
92           xp_assert_close(_cplxpair([+1j, -1j]), [-1j, +1j])
93   
94       def test_unmatched_conjugates(self):
95           # 1+2j is unmatched
96           assert_raises(ValueError, _cplxpair, [1+3j, 1-3j, 1+2j])
97   
98           # 1+2j and 1-3j are unmatched
99           assert_raises(ValueError, _cplxpair, [1+3j, 1-3j, 1+2j, 1-3j])
100  
101          # 1+3j is unmatched
102          assert_raises(ValueError, _cplxpair, [1+3j, 1-3j, 1+3j])
103  
104          # Not conjugates
105          assert_raises(ValueError, _cplxpair, [4+5j, 4+5j])
106          assert_raises(ValueError, _cplxpair, [1-7j, 1-7j])
107  
108          # No pairs
109          assert_raises(ValueError, _cplxpair, [1+3j])
110          assert_raises(ValueError, _cplxpair, [1-3j])
111

113  class TestCplxReal:
114  
115      def test_trivial_input(self):
116          assert all(x.size == 0 for x in _cplxreal([]))
117  
118          x = _cplxreal(1)
119          assert x[0].size == 0
120          xp_assert_equal(x[1], np.asarray([1]))
121  
122  
123      def test_output_order(self):
124          zc, zr = _cplxreal(np.roots(array([1, 0, 0, 1])))
125          xp_assert_close(np.append(zc, zr), [1/2 + 1j*sin(pi/3), -1])
126  
127          eps = spacing(1)
128  
129          a = [0+1j, 0-1j, eps + 1j, eps - 1j, -eps + 1j, -eps - 1j,
130               1, 4, 2, 3, 0, 0,
131               2+3j, 2-3j,
132               1-eps + 1j, 1+2j, 1-2j, 1+eps - 1j,  # sorts out of order
133               3+1j, 3+1j, 3+1j, 3-1j, 3-1j, 3-1j,
134               2-3j, 2+3j]
135          zc, zr = _cplxreal(a)
136          xp_assert_close(zc, [1j, 1j, 1j, 1+1j, 1+2j, 2+3j, 2+3j, 3+1j, 3+1j,
137                               3+1j])
138          xp_assert_close(zr, [0.0, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4])
139  
140          z = array([1-eps + 1j, 1+2j, 1-2j, 1+eps - 1j, 1+eps+3j, 1-2*eps-3j,
141                     0+1j, 0-1j, 2+4j, 2-4j, 2+3j, 2-3j, 3+7j, 3-7j, 4-eps+1j,
142                     4+eps-2j, 4-1j, 4-eps+2j])
143  
144          zc, zr = _cplxreal(z)
145          xp_assert_close(zc, [1j, 1+1j, 1+2j, 1+3j, 2+3j, 2+4j, 3+7j, 4+1j,
146                               4+2j])
147          xp_assert_equal(zr, np.asarray([]))
148  
149      def test_unmatched_conjugates(self):
150          # 1+2j is unmatched
151          assert_raises(ValueError, _cplxreal, [1+3j, 1-3j, 1+2j])
152  
153          # 1+2j and 1-3j are unmatched
154          assert_raises(ValueError, _cplxreal, [1+3j, 1-3j, 1+2j, 1-3j])
155  
156          # 1+3j is unmatched
157          assert_raises(ValueError, _cplxreal, [1+3j, 1-3j, 1+3j])
158  
159          # No pairs
160          assert_raises(ValueError, _cplxreal, [1+3j])
161          assert_raises(ValueError, _cplxreal, [1-3j])
162  
163      def test_real_integer_input(self):
164          zc, zr = _cplxreal([2, 0, 1, 4])
165          xp_assert_equal(zc, [])
166          xp_assert_equal(zr, [0, 1, 2, 4])

169  class TestTf2zpk:
170  
171      @pytest.mark.parametrize('dt', (np.float64, np.complex128))
172      def test_simple(self, dt):
173          z_r = np.array([0.5, -0.5])
174          p_r = np.array([1.j / np.sqrt(2), -1.j / np.sqrt(2)])
175          # Sort the zeros/poles so that we don't fail the test if the order
176          # changes
177          z_r.sort()
178          p_r.sort()
179          b = np.poly(z_r).astype(dt)
180          a = np.poly(p_r).astype(dt)
181  
182          z, p, k = tf2zpk(b, a)
183          z.sort()
184          # The real part of `p` is ~0.0, so sort by imaginary part
185          p = p[np.argsort(p.imag)]
186  
187          assert_array_almost_equal(z, z_r)
188          assert_array_almost_equal(p, p_r)
189          assert_array_almost_equal(k, 1.)
190          assert k.dtype == dt
191  
192      def test_bad_filter(self):
193          # Regression test for #651: better handling of badly conditioned
194          # filter coefficients.
195          with suppress_warnings():
196              warnings.simplefilter("error", BadCoefficients)
197              assert_raises(BadCoefficients, tf2zpk, [1e-15], [1.0, 1.0])
198

200  class TestZpk2Tf:
201  
202      def test_identity(self):
203          """Test the identity transfer function."""
204          z = []
205          p = []
206          k = 1.
207          b, a = zpk2tf(z, p, k)
208          b_r = np.array([1.])  # desired result
209          a_r = np.array([1.])  # desired result
210          # The test for the *type* of the return values is a regression
211          # test for ticket #1095. In the case p=[], zpk2tf used to
212          # return the scalar 1.0 instead of array([1.0]).
213          xp_assert_equal(b, b_r)
214          assert isinstance(b, np.ndarray)
215          xp_assert_equal(a, a_r)
216          assert isinstance(a, np.ndarray)

219  class TestSos2Zpk:
220  
221      def test_basic(self):
222          sos = [[1, 0, 1, 1, 0, -0.81],
223                 [1, 0, 0, 1, 0, +0.49]]
224          z, p, k = sos2zpk(sos)
225          z2 = [1j, -1j, 0, 0]
226          p2 = [0.9, -0.9, 0.7j, -0.7j]
227          k2 = 1
228          assert_array_almost_equal(sort(z), sort(z2), decimal=4)
229          assert_array_almost_equal(sort(p), sort(p2), decimal=4)
230          assert_array_almost_equal(k, k2)
231  
232          sos = [[1.00000, +0.61803, 1.0000, 1.00000, +0.60515, 0.95873],
233                 [1.00000, -1.61803, 1.0000, 1.00000, -1.58430, 0.95873],
234                 [1.00000, +1.00000, 0.0000, 1.00000, +0.97915, 0.00000]]
235          z, p, k = sos2zpk(sos)
236          z2 = [-0.3090 + 0.9511j, -0.3090 - 0.9511j, 0.8090 + 0.5878j,
237                0.8090 - 0.5878j, -1.0000 + 0.0000j, 0]
238          p2 = [-0.3026 + 0.9312j, -0.3026 - 0.9312j, 0.7922 + 0.5755j,
239                0.7922 - 0.5755j, -0.9791 + 0.0000j, 0]
240          k2 = 1
241          assert_array_almost_equal(sort(z), sort(z2), decimal=4)
242          assert_array_almost_equal(sort(p), sort(p2), decimal=4)
243  
244          sos = array([[1, 2, 3, 1, 0.2, 0.3],
245                       [4, 5, 6, 1, 0.4, 0.5]])
246          z = array([-1 - 1.41421356237310j, -1 + 1.41421356237310j,
247                    -0.625 - 1.05326872164704j, -0.625 + 1.05326872164704j])
248          p = array([-0.2 - 0.678232998312527j, -0.2 + 0.678232998312527j,
249                    -0.1 - 0.538516480713450j, -0.1 + 0.538516480713450j])
250          k = 4
251          z2, p2, k2 = sos2zpk(sos)
252          xp_assert_close(_cplxpair(z2), z)
253          xp_assert_close(_cplxpair(p2), p)
254          assert k2 == k
255  
256      @pytest.mark.thread_unsafe
257      def test_fewer_zeros(self):
258          """Test not the expected number of p/z (effectively at origin)."""
259          sos = butter(3, 0.1, output='sos')
260          z, p, k = sos2zpk(sos)
261          assert len(z) == 4
262          assert len(p) == 4
263  
264          sos = butter(12, [5., 30.], 'bandpass', fs=1200., analog=False,
265                      output='sos')
266          with pytest.warns(BadCoefficients, match='Badly conditioned'):
267              z, p, k = sos2zpk(sos)
268          assert len(z) == 24
269          assert len(p) == 24

272  class TestSos2Tf:
273  
274      def test_basic(self):
275          sos = [[1, 1, 1, 1, 0, -1],
276                 [-2, 3, 1, 1, 10, 1]]
277          b, a = sos2tf(sos)
278          assert_array_almost_equal(b, [-2, 1, 2, 4, 1])
279          assert_array_almost_equal(a, [1, 10, 0, -10, -1])

282  class TestTf2Sos:
283  
284      def test_basic(self):
285          num = [2, 16, 44, 56, 32]
286          den = [3, 3, -15, 18, -12]
287          sos = tf2sos(num, den)
288          sos2 = [[0.6667, 4.0000, 5.3333, 1.0000, +2.0000, -4.0000],
289                  [1.0000, 2.0000, 2.0000, 1.0000, -1.0000, +1.0000]]
290          assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
291  
292          b = [1, -3, 11, -27, 18]
293          a = [16, 12, 2, -4, -1]
294          sos = tf2sos(b, a)
295          sos2 = [[0.0625, -0.1875, 0.1250, 1.0000, -0.2500, -0.1250],
296                  [1.0000, +0.0000, 9.0000, 1.0000, +1.0000, +0.5000]]
297          # assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
298  
299      @pytest.mark.parametrize('b, a, analog, sos',
300                               [([1], [1], False, [[1., 0., 0., 1., 0., 0.]]),
301                                ([1], [1], True, [[0., 0., 1., 0., 0., 1.]]),
302                                ([1], [1., 0., -1.01, 0, 0.01], False,
303                                 [[1., 0., 0., 1., 0., -0.01],
304                                  [1., 0., 0., 1., 0., -1]]),
305                                ([1], [1., 0., -1.01, 0, 0.01], True,
306                                 [[0., 0., 1., 1., 0., -1],
307                                  [0., 0., 1., 1., 0., -0.01]])])
308      def test_analog(self, b, a, analog, sos):
309          sos2 = tf2sos(b, a, analog=analog)
310          assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)

312  
313  class TestZpk2Sos:
314  
315      @pytest.mark.parametrize('dt', 'fdgFDG')
316      @pytest.mark.parametrize('pairing, analog',
317                               [('nearest', False),
318                                ('keep_odd', False),
319                                ('minimal', False),
320                                ('minimal', True)])
321      def test_dtypes(self, dt, pairing, analog):
322          z = np.array([-1, -1]).astype(dt)
323          ct = dt.upper()  # the poles have to be complex
324          p = np.array([0.57149 + 0.29360j, 0.57149 - 0.29360j]).astype(ct)
325          k = np.array(1).astype(dt)
326          sos = zpk2sos(z, p, k, pairing=pairing, analog=analog)
327          sos2 = [[1, 2, 1, 1, -1.14298, 0.41280]]  # octave & MATLAB
328          assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
329  
330      def test_basic(self):
331          for pairing in ('nearest', 'keep_odd'):
332              #
333              # Cases that match octave
334              #
335  
336              z = [-1, -1]
337              p = [0.57149 + 0.29360j, 0.57149 - 0.29360j]
338              k = 1
339              sos = zpk2sos(z, p, k, pairing=pairing)
340              sos2 = [[1, 2, 1, 1, -1.14298, 0.41280]]  # octave & MATLAB
341              assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
342  
343              z = [1j, -1j]
344              p = [0.9, -0.9, 0.7j, -0.7j]
345              k = 1
346              sos = zpk2sos(z, p, k, pairing=pairing)
347              sos2 = [[1, 0, 1, 1, 0, +0.49],
348                      [1, 0, 0, 1, 0, -0.81]]  # octave
349              # sos2 = [[0, 0, 1, 1, -0.9, 0],
350              #         [1, 0, 1, 1, 0.9, 0]]  # MATLAB
351              assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
352  
353              z = []
354              p = [0.8, -0.5+0.25j, -0.5-0.25j]
355              k = 1.
356              sos = zpk2sos(z, p, k, pairing=pairing)
357              sos2 = [[1., 0., 0., 1., 1., 0.3125],
358                      [1., 0., 0., 1., -0.8, 0.]]  # octave, MATLAB fails
359              assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
360  
361              z = [1., 1., 0.9j, -0.9j]
362              p = [0.99+0.01j, 0.99-0.01j, 0.1+0.9j, 0.1-0.9j]
363              k = 1
364              sos = zpk2sos(z, p, k, pairing=pairing)
365              sos2 = [[1, 0, 0.81, 1, -0.2, 0.82],
366                      [1, -2, 1, 1, -1.98, 0.9802]]  # octave
367              # sos2 = [[1, -2, 1, 1,  -0.2, 0.82],
368              #         [1, 0, 0.81, 1, -1.98, 0.9802]]  # MATLAB
369              assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
370  
371              z = [0.9+0.1j, 0.9-0.1j, -0.9]
372              p = [0.75+0.25j, 0.75-0.25j, 0.9]
373              k = 1
374              sos = zpk2sos(z, p, k, pairing=pairing)
375              if pairing == 'keep_odd':
376                  sos2 = [[1, -1.8, 0.82, 1, -1.5, 0.625],
377                          [1, 0.9, 0, 1, -0.9, 0]]  # octave; MATLAB fails
378                  assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
379              else:  # pairing == 'nearest'
380                  sos2 = [[1, 0.9, 0, 1, -1.5, 0.625],
381                          [1, -1.8, 0.82, 1, -0.9, 0]]  # our algorithm
382                  assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
383  
384              #
385              # Cases that differ from octave:
386              #
387  
388              z = [-0.3090 + 0.9511j, -0.3090 - 0.9511j, 0.8090 + 0.5878j,
389                   +0.8090 - 0.5878j, -1.0000 + 0.0000j]
390              p = [-0.3026 + 0.9312j, -0.3026 - 0.9312j, 0.7922 + 0.5755j,
391                   +0.7922 - 0.5755j, -0.9791 + 0.0000j]
392              k = 1
393              sos = zpk2sos(z, p, k, pairing=pairing)
394              # sos2 = [[1, 0.618, 1, 1, 0.6052, 0.95870],
395              #         [1, -1.618, 1, 1, -1.5844, 0.95878],
396              #         [1, 1, 0, 1, 0.9791, 0]]  # octave, MATLAB fails
397              sos2 = [[1, 1, 0, 1, +0.97915, 0],
398                      [1, 0.61803, 1, 1, +0.60515, 0.95873],
399                      [1, -1.61803, 1, 1, -1.58430, 0.95873]]
400              assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
401  
402              z = [-1 - 1.4142j, -1 + 1.4142j,
403                   -0.625 - 1.0533j, -0.625 + 1.0533j]
404              p = [-0.2 - 0.6782j, -0.2 + 0.6782j,
405                   -0.1 - 0.5385j, -0.1 + 0.5385j]
406              k = 4
407              sos = zpk2sos(z, p, k, pairing=pairing)
408              sos2 = [[4, 8, 12, 1, 0.2, 0.3],
409                      [1, 1.25, 1.5, 1, 0.4, 0.5]]  # MATLAB
410              # sos2 = [[4, 8, 12, 1, 0.4, 0.5],
411              #         [1, 1.25, 1.5, 1, 0.2, 0.3]]  # octave
412              xp_assert_close(sos, sos2, rtol=1e-4, atol=1e-4)
413  
414              z = []
415              p = [0.2, -0.5+0.25j, -0.5-0.25j]
416              k = 1.
417              sos = zpk2sos(z, p, k, pairing=pairing)
418              sos2 = [[1., 0., 0., 1., -0.2, 0.],
419                      [1., 0., 0., 1., 1., 0.3125]]
420              # sos2 = [[1., 0., 0., 1., 1., 0.3125],
421              #         [1., 0., 0., 1., -0.2, 0]]  # octave, MATLAB fails
422              assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
423  
424              # The next two examples are adapted from Leland B. Jackson,
425              # "Digital Filters and Signal Processing (1995) p.400:
426              # http://books.google.com/books?id=VZ8uabI1pNMC&lpg=PA400&ots=gRD9pi8Jua&dq=Pole%2Fzero%20pairing%20for%20minimum%20roundoff%20noise%20in%20BSF.&pg=PA400#v=onepage&q=Pole%2Fzero%20pairing%20for%20minimum%20roundoff%20noise%20in%20BSF.&f=false
427  
428              deg2rad = np.pi / 180.
429              k = 1.
430  
431              # first example
432              thetas = [22.5, 45, 77.5]
433              mags = [0.8, 0.6, 0.9]
434              z = np.array([np.exp(theta * deg2rad * 1j) for theta in thetas])
435              z = np.concatenate((z, np.conj(z)))
436              p = np.array([mag * np.exp(theta * deg2rad * 1j)
437                            for theta, mag in zip(thetas, mags)])
438              p = np.concatenate((p, np.conj(p)))
439              sos = zpk2sos(z, p, k)
440              # sos2 = [[1, -0.43288, 1, 1, -0.38959, 0.81],  # octave,
441              #         [1, -1.41421, 1, 1, -0.84853, 0.36],  # MATLAB fails
442              #         [1, -1.84776, 1, 1, -1.47821, 0.64]]
443              # Note that pole-zero pairing matches, but ordering is different
444              sos2 = [[1, -1.41421, 1, 1, -0.84853, 0.36],
445                      [1, -1.84776, 1, 1, -1.47821, 0.64],
446                      [1, -0.43288, 1, 1, -0.38959, 0.81]]
447              assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
448  
449              # second example
450              z = np.array([np.exp(theta * deg2rad * 1j)
451                            for theta in (85., 10.)])
452              z = np.concatenate((z, np.conj(z), [1, -1]))
453              sos = zpk2sos(z, p, k)
454  
455              # sos2 = [[1, -0.17431, 1, 1, -0.38959, 0.81],  # octave "wrong",
456              #         [1, -1.96962, 1, 1, -0.84853, 0.36],  # MATLAB fails
457              #         [1, 0, -1, 1, -1.47821, 0.64000]]
458              # Our pole-zero pairing matches the text, Octave does not
459              sos2 = [[1, 0, -1, 1, -0.84853, 0.36],
460                      [1, -1.96962, 1, 1, -1.47821, 0.64],
461                      [1, -0.17431, 1, 1, -0.38959, 0.81]]
462              assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
463  
464      # these examples are taken from the doc string, and show the
465      # effect of the 'pairing' argument
466      @pytest.mark.parametrize('pairing, sos',
467                               [('nearest',
468                                 np.array([[1., 1., 0.5, 1., -0.75, 0.],
469                                           [1., 1., 0., 1., -1.6, 0.65]])),
470                                ('keep_odd',
471                                 np.array([[1., 1., 0, 1., -0.75, 0.],
472                                           [1., 1., 0.5, 1., -1.6, 0.65]])),
473                                ('minimal',
474                                 np.array([[0., 1., 1., 0., 1., -0.75],
475                                           [1., 1., 0.5, 1., -1.6, 0.65]]))])
476      def test_pairing(self, pairing, sos):
477          z1 = np.array([-1, -0.5-0.5j, -0.5+0.5j])
478          p1 = np.array([0.75, 0.8+0.1j, 0.8-0.1j])
479          sos2 = zpk2sos(z1, p1, 1, pairing=pairing)
480          assert_array_almost_equal(sos, sos2, decimal=4)
481  
482      @pytest.mark.parametrize('p, sos_dt',
483                               [([-1, 1, -0.1, 0.1],
484                                 [[0., 0., 1., 1., 0., -0.01],
485                                  [0., 0., 1., 1., 0., -1]]),
486                                ([-0.7071+0.7071j, -0.7071-0.7071j, -0.1j, 0.1j],
487                                 [[0., 0., 1., 1., 0., 0.01],
488                                  [0., 0., 1., 1., 1.4142, 1.]])])
489      def test_analog(self, p, sos_dt):
490          # test `analog` argument
491          # for discrete time, poles closest to unit circle should appear last
492          # for cont. time, poles closest to imaginary axis should appear last
493          sos2_dt = zpk2sos([], p, 1, pairing='minimal', analog=False)
494          sos2_ct = zpk2sos([], p, 1, pairing='minimal', analog=True)
495          assert_array_almost_equal(sos_dt, sos2_dt, decimal=4)
496          assert_array_almost_equal(sos_dt[::-1], sos2_ct, decimal=4)
497  
498      def test_bad_args(self):
499          with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=r'pairing must be one of'):
500              zpk2sos([1], [2], 1, pairing='no_such_pairing')
501  
502          with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=r'.*pairing must be "minimal"'):
503              zpk2sos([1], [2], 1, pairing='keep_odd', analog=True)
504  
505          with pytest.raises(ValueError,
506                             match=r'.*must have len\(p\)>=len\(z\)'):
507              zpk2sos([1, 1], [2], 1, analog=True)
508  
509          with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=r'k must be real'):
510              zpk2sos([1], [2], k=1j)
511

513  class TestFreqs:
514  
515      def test_basic(self):
516          _, h = freqs([1.0], [1.0], worN=8)
517          assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(8))
518  
519      def test_output(self):
520          # 1st order low-pass filter: H(s) = 1 / (s + 1)
521          w = [0.1, 1, 10, 100]
522          num = [1]
523          den = [1, 1]
524          w, H = freqs(num, den, worN=w)
525          s = w * 1j
526          expected = 1 / (s + 1)
527          assert_array_almost_equal(H.real, expected.real)
528          assert_array_almost_equal(H.imag, expected.imag)
529  
530      def test_freq_range(self):
531          # Test that freqresp() finds a reasonable frequency range.
532          # 1st order low-pass filter: H(s) = 1 / (s + 1)
533          # Expected range is from 0.01 to 10.
534          num = [1]
535          den = [1, 1]
536          n = 10
537          expected_w = np.logspace(-2, 1, n)
538          w, H = freqs(num, den, worN=n)
539          assert_array_almost_equal(w, expected_w)
540  
541      def test_plot(self):
542  
543          def plot(w, h):
544              assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(8))
545  
546          assert_raises(ZeroDivisionError, freqs, [1.0], [1.0], worN=8,
547                        plot=lambda w, h: 1 / 0)
548          freqs([1.0], [1.0], worN=8, plot=plot)
549  
550      def test_backward_compat(self):
551          # For backward compatibility, test if None act as a wrapper for default
552          w1, h1 = freqs([1.0], [1.0])
553          w2, h2 = freqs([1.0], [1.0], None)
554          assert_array_almost_equal(w1, w2)
555          assert_array_almost_equal(h1, h2)
556  
557      def test_w_or_N_types(self):
558          # Measure at 8 equally-spaced points
559          for N in (8, np.int8(8), np.int16(8), np.int32(8), np.int64(8),
560                    np.array(8)):
561              w, h = freqs([1.0], [1.0], worN=N)
562              assert len(w) == 8
563              assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(8))
564  
565          # Measure at frequency 8 rad/sec
566          for w in (8.0, 8.0+0j):
567              w_out, h = freqs([1.0], [1.0], worN=w)
568              assert_array_almost_equal(w_out, [8])
569              assert_array_almost_equal(h, [1])

633  class TestFreqz:
634  
635      def test_ticket1441(self):
636          """Regression test for ticket 1441."""
637          # Because freqz previously used arange instead of linspace,
638          # when N was large, it would return one more point than
639          # requested.
640          N = 100000
641          w, h = freqz([1.0], worN=N)
642          assert w.shape == (N,)
643  
644      def test_basic(self):
645          w, h = freqz([1.0], worN=8)
646          assert_array_almost_equal(w, np.pi * np.arange(8) / 8.)
647          assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(8))
648          w, h = freqz([1.0], worN=9)
649          assert_array_almost_equal(w, np.pi * np.arange(9) / 9.)
650          assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(9))
651  
652          for a in [1, np.ones(2)]:
653              w, h = freqz(np.ones(2), a, worN=0)
654              assert w.shape == (0,)
655              assert h.shape == (0,)
656              assert h.dtype == np.dtype('complex128')
657  
658          t = np.linspace(0, 1, 4, endpoint=False)
659          for b, a, h_whole in zip(
660                  ([1., 0, 0, 0], np.sin(2 * np.pi * t)),
661                  ([1., 0, 0, 0], [0.5, 0, 0, 0]),
662                  ([1., 1., 1., 1.], [0, -4j, 0, 4j])):
663              w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=4, whole=True)
664              expected_w = np.linspace(0, 2 * np.pi, 4, endpoint=False)
665              assert_array_almost_equal(w, expected_w)
666              assert_array_almost_equal(h, h_whole)
667              # simultaneously check int-like support
668              w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=np.int32(4), whole=True)
669              assert_array_almost_equal(w, expected_w)
670              assert_array_almost_equal(h, h_whole)
671              w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=w, whole=True)
672              assert_array_almost_equal(w, expected_w)
673              assert_array_almost_equal(h, h_whole)
674  
675      def test_basic_whole(self):
676          w, h = freqz([1.0], worN=8, whole=True)
677          assert_array_almost_equal(w, 2 * np.pi * np.arange(8.0) / 8)
678          assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(8))
679  
680      def test_plot(self):
681  
682          def plot(w, h):
683              assert_array_almost_equal(w, np.pi * np.arange(8.0) / 8)
684              assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(8))
685  
686          assert_raises(ZeroDivisionError, freqz, [1.0], worN=8,
687                        plot=lambda w, h: 1 / 0)
688          freqz([1.0], worN=8, plot=plot)

690      def test_fft_wrapping(self):
691          # Some simple real FIR filters
692          bs = list()  # filters
693          as_ = list()
694          hs_whole = list()
695          hs_half = list()
696          # 3 taps
697          t = np.linspace(0, 1, 3, endpoint=False)
698          bs.append(np.sin(2 * np.pi * t))
699          as_.append(3.)
700          hs_whole.append([0, -0.5j, 0.5j])
701          hs_half.append([0, np.sqrt(1./12.), -0.5j])
702          # 4 taps
703          t = np.linspace(0, 1, 4, endpoint=False)
704          bs.append(np.sin(2 * np.pi * t))
705          as_.append(0.5)
706          hs_whole.append([0, -4j, 0, 4j])
707          hs_half.append([0, np.sqrt(8), -4j, -np.sqrt(8)])
708          del t
709          for ii, b in enumerate(bs):
710              # whole
711              a = as_[ii]
712              expected_w = np.linspace(0, 2 * np.pi, len(b), endpoint=False)
713              w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=expected_w, whole=True)  # polyval
714              err_msg = f'b = {b}, a={a}'
715              assert_array_almost_equal(w, expected_w, err_msg=err_msg)
716              assert_array_almost_equal(h, hs_whole[ii], err_msg=err_msg)
717              w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=len(b), whole=True)  # FFT
718              assert_array_almost_equal(w, expected_w, err_msg=err_msg)
719              assert_array_almost_equal(h, hs_whole[ii], err_msg=err_msg)
720              # non-whole
721              expected_w = np.linspace(0, np.pi, len(b), endpoint=False)
722              w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=expected_w, whole=False)  # polyval
723              assert_array_almost_equal(w, expected_w, err_msg=err_msg)
724              assert_array_almost_equal(h, hs_half[ii], err_msg=err_msg)
725              w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=len(b), whole=False)  # FFT
726              assert_array_almost_equal(w, expected_w, err_msg=err_msg)
727              assert_array_almost_equal(h, hs_half[ii], err_msg=err_msg)
728  
729          # some random FIR filters (real + complex)
730          # assume polyval is accurate
731          rng = np.random.RandomState(0)
732          for ii in range(2, 10):  # number of taps
733              b = rng.randn(ii)
734              for kk in range(2):
735                  a = rng.randn(1) if kk == 0 else rng.randn(3)
736                  for jj in range(2):
737                      if jj == 1:
738                          b = b + rng.randn(ii) * 1j
739                      # whole
740                      expected_w = np.linspace(0, 2 * np.pi, ii, endpoint=False)
741                      w, expected_h = freqz(b, a, worN=expected_w, whole=True)
742                      assert_array_almost_equal(w, expected_w)
743                      w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=ii, whole=True)
744                      assert_array_almost_equal(w, expected_w)
745                      assert_array_almost_equal(h, expected_h)
746                      # half
747                      expected_w = np.linspace(0, np.pi, ii, endpoint=False)
748                      w, expected_h = freqz(b, a, worN=expected_w, whole=False)
749                      assert_array_almost_equal(w, expected_w)
750                      w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=ii, whole=False)
751                      assert_array_almost_equal(w, expected_w)
752                      assert_array_almost_equal(h, expected_h)
753  
754      def test_broadcasting1(self):
755          # Test broadcasting with worN an integer or a 1-D array,
756          # b and a are n-dimensional arrays.
757          np.random.seed(123)
758          b = np.random.rand(3, 5, 1)
759          a = np.random.rand(2, 1)
760          for whole in [False, True]:
761              # Test with worN being integers (one fast for FFT and one not),
762              # a 1-D array, and an empty array.
763              for worN in [16, 17, np.linspace(0, 1, 10), np.array([])]:
764                  w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=worN, whole=whole)
765                  for k in range(b.shape[1]):
766                      bk = b[:, k, 0]
767                      ak = a[:, 0]
768                      ww, hh = freqz(bk, ak, worN=worN, whole=whole)
769                      xp_assert_close(ww, w)
770                      xp_assert_close(hh, h[k])
771  
772      def test_broadcasting2(self):
773          # Test broadcasting with worN an integer or a 1-D array,
774          # b is an n-dimensional array, and a is left at the default value.
775          np.random.seed(123)
776          b = np.random.rand(3, 5, 1)
777          for whole in [False, True]:
778              for worN in [16, 17, np.linspace(0, 1, 10)]:
779                  w, h = freqz(b, worN=worN, whole=whole)
780                  for k in range(b.shape[1]):
781                      bk = b[:, k, 0]
782                      ww, hh = freqz(bk, worN=worN, whole=whole)
783                      xp_assert_close(ww, w)
784                      xp_assert_close(hh, h[k])
785  
786      def test_broadcasting3(self):
787          # Test broadcasting where b.shape[-1] is the same length
788          # as worN, and a is left at the default value.
789          np.random.seed(123)
790          N = 16
791          b = np.random.rand(3, N)
792          for whole in [False, True]:
793              for worN in [N, np.linspace(0, 1, N)]:
794                  w, h = freqz(b, worN=worN, whole=whole)
795                  assert w.size == N
796                  for k in range(N):
797                      bk = b[:, k]
798                      ww, hh = freqz(bk, worN=w[k], whole=whole)
799                      xp_assert_close(ww, np.asarray(w[k])[None])
800                      xp_assert_close(hh, np.asarray(h[k])[None])
801  
802      def test_broadcasting4(self):
803          # Test broadcasting with worN a 2-D array.
804          np.random.seed(123)
805          b = np.random.rand(4, 2, 1, 1)
806          a = np.random.rand(5, 2, 1, 1)
807          for whole in [False, True]:
808              for worN in [np.random.rand(6, 7), np.empty((6, 0))]:
809                  w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=worN, whole=whole)
810                  xp_assert_close(w, worN, rtol=1e-14)
811                  assert h.shape == (2,) + worN.shape
812                  for k in range(2):
813                      ww, hh = freqz(b[:, k, 0, 0], a[:, k, 0, 0],
814                                     worN=worN.ravel(),
815                                     whole=whole)
816                      xp_assert_close(ww, worN.ravel(), rtol=1e-14)
817                      xp_assert_close(hh, h[k, :, :].ravel())

826      def test_fs_param(self):
827          fs = 900
828          b = [0.039479155677484369, 0.11843746703245311, 0.11843746703245311,
829               0.039479155677484369]
830          a = [1.0, -1.3199152021838287, 0.80341991081938424,
831               -0.16767146321568049]
832  
833          # N = None, whole=False
834          w1, h1 = freqz(b, a, fs=fs)
835          w2, h2 = freqz(b, a)
836          xp_assert_close(h1, h2)
837          xp_assert_close(w1, np.linspace(0, fs/2, 512, endpoint=False))
838  
839          # N = None, whole=True
840          w1, h1 = freqz(b, a, whole=True, fs=fs)
841          w2, h2 = freqz(b, a, whole=True)
842          xp_assert_close(h1, h2)
843          xp_assert_close(w1, np.linspace(0, fs, 512, endpoint=False))
844  
845          # N = 5, whole=False
846          w1, h1 = freqz(b, a, 5, fs=fs)
847          w2, h2 = freqz(b, a, 5)
848          xp_assert_close(h1, h2)
849          xp_assert_close(w1, np.linspace(0, fs/2, 5, endpoint=False))
850  
851          # N = 5, whole=True
852          w1, h1 = freqz(b, a, 5, whole=True, fs=fs)
853          w2, h2 = freqz(b, a, 5, whole=True)
854          xp_assert_close(h1, h2)
855          xp_assert_close(w1, np.linspace(0, fs, 5, endpoint=False))
856  
857          # w is an array_like
858          for w in ([123], (123,), np.array([123]), (50, 123, 230),
859                    np.array([50, 123, 230])):
860              w1, h1 = freqz(b, a, w, fs=fs)
861              w2, h2 = freqz(b, a, 2*pi*np.array(w)/fs)
862              xp_assert_close(h1, h2)
863              xp_assert_close(w, w1, check_dtype=False)
864  
865      def test_w_or_N_types(self):
866          # Measure at 7 (polyval) or 8 (fft) equally-spaced points
867          for N in (7, np.int8(7), np.int16(7), np.int32(7), np.int64(7),
868                    np.array(7),
869                    8, np.int8(8), np.int16(8), np.int32(8), np.int64(8),
870                    np.array(8)):
871  
872              w, h = freqz([1.0], worN=N)
873              assert_array_almost_equal(w, np.pi * np.arange(N) / N)
874              assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(N))
875  
876              w, h = freqz([1.0], worN=N, fs=100)
877              assert_array_almost_equal(w, np.linspace(0, 50, N, endpoint=False))
878              assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(N))
879  
880          # Measure at frequency 8 Hz
881          for w in (8.0, 8.0+0j):
882              # Only makes sense when fs is specified
883              w_out, h = freqz([1.0], worN=w, fs=100)
884              assert_array_almost_equal(w_out, [8])
885              assert_array_almost_equal(h, [1])

887      def test_nyquist(self):
888          w, h = freqz([1.0], worN=8, include_nyquist=True)
889          assert_array_almost_equal(w, np.pi * np.arange(8) / 7.)
890          assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(8))
891          w, h = freqz([1.0], worN=9, include_nyquist=True)
892          assert_array_almost_equal(w, np.pi * np.arange(9) / 8.)
893          assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(9))
894  
895          for a in [1, np.ones(2)]:
896              w, h = freqz(np.ones(2), a, worN=0, include_nyquist=True)
897              assert w.shape == (0,)
898              assert h.shape == (0,)
899              assert h.dtype == np.dtype('complex128')
900  
901          w1, h1 = freqz([1.0], worN=8, whole = True, include_nyquist=True)
902          w2, h2 = freqz([1.0], worN=8, whole = True, include_nyquist=False)
903          assert_array_almost_equal(w1, w2)
904          assert_array_almost_equal(h1, h2)

906      # https://github.com/scipy/scipy/issues/17289
907      # https://github.com/scipy/scipy/issues/15273
908      @pytest.mark.parametrize('whole,nyquist,worN',
909                               [(False, False, 32),
910                                (False, True, 32),
911                                (True, False, 32),
912                                (True, True, 32),
913                                (False, False, 257),
914                                (False, True, 257),
915                                (True, False, 257),
916                                (True, True, 257)])
917      def test_17289(self, whole, nyquist, worN):
918          d = [0, 1]
919          w, Drfft = freqz(d, worN=32, whole=whole, include_nyquist=nyquist)
920          _, Dpoly = freqz(d, worN=w)
921          xp_assert_close(Drfft, Dpoly)

933      def test_freqz_sos_basic(self):
934          # Compare the results of freqz and freqz_sos for a low order
935          # Butterworth filter.
936  
937          N = 500
938  
939          b, a = butter(4, 0.2)
940          sos = butter(4, 0.2, output='sos')
941          w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=N)
942          w2, h2 = freqz_sos(sos, worN=N)
943          xp_assert_equal(w2, w)
944          xp_assert_close(h2, h, rtol=1e-10, atol=1e-14)
945  
946          b, a = ellip(3, 1, 30, (0.2, 0.3), btype='bandpass')
947          sos = ellip(3, 1, 30, (0.2, 0.3), btype='bandpass', output='sos')
948          w, h = freqz(b, a, worN=N)
949          w2, h2 = freqz_sos(sos, worN=N)
950          xp_assert_equal(w2, w)
951          xp_assert_close(h2, h, rtol=1e-10, atol=1e-14)
952          # must have at least one section
953          assert_raises(ValueError, freqz_sos, sos[:0])
954  
955      def test_backward_compat(self):
956          # For backward compatibility, test if None act as a wrapper for default
957          N = 500

960          w1, h1 = freqz_sos(sos, worN=N)
961          w2, h2 = sosfreqz(sos, worN=N)
962          assert_array_almost_equal(w1, w2)
963          assert_array_almost_equal(h1, h2)

965      def test_freqz_sos_design(self):
966          # Compare freqz_sos output against expected values for different
967          # filter types
968  
969          # from cheb2ord
970          N, Wn = cheb2ord([0.1, 0.6], [0.2, 0.5], 3, 60)
971          sos = cheby2(N, 60, Wn, 'stop', output='sos')
972          w, h = freqz_sos(sos)
973          h = np.abs(h)
974          w /= np.pi
975          xp_assert_close(20 * np.log10(h[w <= 0.1]), np.asarray(0.), atol=3.01,
976                          check_shape=False)
977          xp_assert_close(20 * np.log10(h[w >= 0.6]), np.asarray(0.), atol=3.01,
978                          check_shape=False)
979          xp_assert_close(h[(w >= 0.2) & (w <= 0.5)],
980                          np.asarray(0.), atol=1e-3,
981                          check_shape=False)  # <= -60 dB
982  
983          N, Wn = cheb2ord([0.1, 0.6], [0.2, 0.5], 3, 150)
984          sos = cheby2(N, 150, Wn, 'stop', output='sos')
985          w, h = freqz_sos(sos)
986          dB = 20*np.log10(np.abs(h))
987          w /= np.pi
988          xp_assert_close(dB[w <= 0.1], np.asarray(0.0), atol=3.01, check_shape=False)
989          xp_assert_close(dB[w >= 0.6], np.asarray(0.0), atol=3.01, check_shape=False)
990          assert np.all(dB[(w >= 0.2) & (w <= 0.5)] < -149.9)
991  
992          # from cheb1ord
993          N, Wn = cheb1ord(0.2, 0.3, 3, 40)
994          sos = cheby1(N, 3, Wn, 'low', output='sos')
995          w, h = freqz_sos(sos)
996          h = np.abs(h)
997          w /= np.pi
998          xp_assert_close(20 * np.log10(h[w <= 0.2]), np.asarray(0.0), atol=3.01,
999                          check_shape=False)
1000         xp_assert_close(h[w >= 0.3], np.asarray(0.0), atol=1e-2,
1001                         check_shape=False)  # <= -40 dB
1002 
1003         N, Wn = cheb1ord(0.2, 0.3, 1, 150)
1004         sos = cheby1(N, 1, Wn, 'low', output='sos')
1005         w, h = freqz_sos(sos)
1006         dB = 20*np.log10(np.abs(h))
1007         w /= np.pi
1008         xp_assert_close(dB[w <= 0.2], np.asarray(0.0), atol=1.01,
1009                         check_shape=False)
1010         assert np.all(dB[w >= 0.3] < -149.9)
1011 
1012         # adapted from ellipord
1013         N, Wn = ellipord(0.3, 0.2, 3, 60)
1014         sos = ellip(N, 0.3, 60, Wn, 'high', output='sos')
1015         w, h = freqz_sos(sos)
1016         h = np.abs(h)
1017         w /= np.pi
1018         xp_assert_close(20 * np.log10(h[w >= 0.3]), np.asarray(0.0), atol=3.01,
1019                         check_shape=False)
1020         xp_assert_close(h[w <= 0.1], np.asarray(0.0), atol=1.5e-3,
1021                         check_shape=False)  # <= -60 dB (approx)
1022 
1023         # adapted from buttord
1024         N, Wn = buttord([0.2, 0.5], [0.14, 0.6], 3, 40)
1025         sos = butter(N, Wn, 'band', output='sos')
1026         w, h = freqz_sos(sos)
1027         h = np.abs(h)
1028         w /= np.pi
1029 
1030         h014 = h[w <= 0.14]
1031         xp_assert_close(h014, np.zeros_like(h014), atol=1e-2)  # <= -40 dB
1032         h06 = h[w >= 0.6]
1033         xp_assert_close(h06, np.zeros_like(h06), atol=1e-2)  # <= -40 dB
1034         h0205 = 20 * np.log10(h[(w >= 0.2) & (w <= 0.5)])
1035         xp_assert_close(h0205, np.zeros_like(h0205), atol=3.01)
1036 
1037         N, Wn = buttord([0.2, 0.5], [0.14, 0.6], 3, 100)
1038         sos = butter(N, Wn, 'band', output='sos')
1039         w, h = freqz_sos(sos)
1040         dB = 20*np.log10(np.maximum(np.abs(h), 1e-10))
1041         w /= np.pi
1042 
1043         assert np.all(dB[(w > 0) & (w <= 0.14)] < -99.9)
1044         assert np.all(dB[w >= 0.6] < -99.9)
1045         db0205 = dB[(w >= 0.2) & (w <= 0.5)]
1046         xp_assert_close(db0205, np.zeros_like(db0205), atol=3.01)
1047 
1048     def test_freqz_sos_design_ellip(self):
1049         N, Wn = ellipord(0.3, 0.1, 3, 60)
1050         sos = ellip(N, 0.3, 60, Wn, 'high', output='sos')
1051         w, h = freqz_sos(sos)
1052         h = np.abs(h)
1053         w /= np.pi
1054 
1055         h03 = 20 * np.log10(h[w >= 0.3])
1056         xp_assert_close(h03, np.zeros_like(h03), atol=3.01)
1057         h01 = h[w <= 0.1]
1058         xp_assert_close(h01, np.zeros_like(h01), atol=1.5e-3)  # <= -60 dB (approx)
1059 
1060         N, Wn = ellipord(0.3, 0.2, .5, 150)
1061         sos = ellip(N, .5, 150, Wn, 'high', output='sos')
1062         w, h = freqz_sos(sos)
1063         dB = 20*np.log10(np.maximum(np.abs(h), 1e-10))
1064         w /= np.pi
1065 
1066         db03 = dB[w >= 0.3]
1067         xp_assert_close(db03, np.zeros_like(db03), atol=.55)
1068         # Allow some numerical slop in the upper bound -150, so this is
1069         # a check that dB[w <= 0.2] is less than or almost equal to -150.
1070         assert dB[w <= 0.2].max() < -150*(1 - 1e-12)

1072     @mpmath_check("0.10")
1073     def test_freqz_sos_against_mp(self):
1074         # Compare the result of freqz_sos applied to a high order Butterworth
1075         # filter against the result computed using mpmath.  (signal.freqz fails
1076         # miserably with such high order filters.)
1077         from . import mpsig
1078         N = 500
1079         order = 25
1080         Wn = 0.15
1081         with mpmath.workdps(80):
1082             z_mp, p_mp, k_mp = mpsig.butter_lp(order, Wn)
1083             w_mp, h_mp = mpsig.zpkfreqz(z_mp, p_mp, k_mp, N)
1084         w_mp = np.array([float(x) for x in w_mp])
1085         h_mp = np.array([complex(x) for x in h_mp])
1086 
1087         sos = butter(order, Wn, output='sos')
1088         w, h = freqz_sos(sos, worN=N)
1089         xp_assert_close(w, w_mp, rtol=1e-12, atol=1e-14)
1090         xp_assert_close(h, h_mp, rtol=1e-12, atol=1e-14)

1092     def test_fs_param(self):
1093         fs = 900
1094         sos = [[0.03934683014103762, 0.07869366028207524, 0.03934683014103762,
1095                 1.0, -0.37256600288916636, 0.0],
1096                [1.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1.0, -0.9495739996946778, 0.45125966317124144]]
1097 
1098         # N = None, whole=False
1099         w1, h1 = freqz_sos(sos, fs=fs)
1100         w2, h2 = freqz_sos(sos)
1101         xp_assert_close(h1, h2)
1102         xp_assert_close(w1, np.linspace(0, fs/2, 512, endpoint=False))
1103 
1104         # N = None, whole=True
1105         w1, h1 = freqz_sos(sos, whole=True, fs=fs)
1106         w2, h2 = freqz_sos(sos, whole=True)
1107         xp_assert_close(h1, h2, atol=1e-27)
1108         xp_assert_close(w1, np.linspace(0, fs, 512, endpoint=False))
1109 
1110         # N = 5, whole=False
1111         w1, h1 = freqz_sos(sos, 5, fs=fs)
1112         w2, h2 = freqz_sos(sos, 5)
1113         xp_assert_close(h1, h2)
1114         xp_assert_close(w1, np.linspace(0, fs/2, 5, endpoint=False))
1115 
1116         # N = 5, whole=True
1117         w1, h1 = freqz_sos(sos, 5, whole=True, fs=fs)
1118         w2, h2 = freqz_sos(sos, 5, whole=True)
1119         xp_assert_close(h1, h2)
1120         xp_assert_close(w1, np.linspace(0, fs, 5, endpoint=False))
1121 
1122         # w is an array_like
1123         for w in ([123], (123,), np.array([123]), (50, 123, 230),
1124                   np.array([50, 123, 230])):
1125             w1, h1 = freqz_sos(sos, w, fs=fs)
1126             w2, h2 = freqz_sos(sos, 2*pi*np.array(w)/fs)
1127             xp_assert_close(h1, h2)
1128             xp_assert_close(w, w1, check_dtype=False)
1129 
1130     def test_w_or_N_types(self):
1131         # Measure at 7 (polyval) or 8 (fft) equally-spaced points
1132         for N in (7, np.int8(7), np.int16(7), np.int32(7), np.int64(7),
1133                   np.array(7),
1134                   8, np.int8(8), np.int16(8), np.int32(8), np.int64(8),
1135                   np.array(8)):
1136 
1137             w, h = freqz_sos([1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0], worN=N)
1138             assert_array_almost_equal(w, np.pi * np.arange(N) / N)
1139             assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(N))
1140 
1141             w, h = freqz_sos([1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0], worN=N, fs=100)
1142             assert_array_almost_equal(w, np.linspace(0, 50, N, endpoint=False))
1143             assert_array_almost_equal(h, np.ones(N))
1144 
1145         # Measure at frequency 8 Hz
1146         for w in (8.0, 8.0+0j):
1147             # Only makes sense when fs is specified
1148             w_out, h = freqz_sos([1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0], worN=w, fs=100)
1149             assert_array_almost_equal(w_out, [8])
1150             assert_array_almost_equal(h, [1])

1155             freqz_sos(sos, fs=np.array([10, 20]))

1262 class TestNormalize:
1263 
1264     def test_allclose(self):
1265         """Test for false positive on allclose in normalize() in 
1266         filter_design.py"""
1267         # Test to make sure the allclose call within signal.normalize does not
1268         # choose false positives. Then check against a known output from MATLAB
1269         # to make sure the fix doesn't break anything.
1270 
1271         # These are the coefficients returned from
1272         #   `[b,a] = cheby1(8, 0.5, 0.048)'
1273         # in MATLAB. There are at least 15 significant figures in each
1274         # coefficient, so it makes sense to test for errors on the order of
1275         # 1e-13 (this can always be relaxed if different platforms have
1276         # different rounding errors)
1277         b_matlab = np.array([2.150733144728282e-11, 1.720586515782626e-10,
1278                              6.022052805239190e-10, 1.204410561047838e-09,
1279                              1.505513201309798e-09, 1.204410561047838e-09,
1280                              6.022052805239190e-10, 1.720586515782626e-10,
1281                              2.150733144728282e-11])
1282         a_matlab = np.array([1.000000000000000e+00, -7.782402035027959e+00,
1283                              2.654354569747454e+01, -5.182182531666387e+01,
1284                              6.334127355102684e+01, -4.963358186631157e+01,
1285                              2.434862182949389e+01, -6.836925348604676e+00,
1286                              8.412934944449140e-01])
1287 
1288         # This is the input to signal.normalize after passing through the
1289         # equivalent steps in signal.iirfilter as was done for MATLAB
1290         b_norm_in = np.array([1.5543135865293012e-06, 1.2434508692234413e-05,
1291                               4.3520780422820447e-05, 8.7041560845640893e-05,
1292                               1.0880195105705122e-04, 8.7041560845640975e-05,
1293                               4.3520780422820447e-05, 1.2434508692234413e-05,
1294                               1.5543135865293012e-06])
1295         a_norm_in = np.array([7.2269025909127173e+04, -5.6242661430467968e+05,
1296                               1.9182761917308895e+06, -3.7451128364682454e+06,
1297                               4.5776121393762771e+06, -3.5869706138592605e+06,
1298                               1.7596511818472347e+06, -4.9409793515707983e+05,
1299                               6.0799461347219651e+04])
1300 
1301         b_output, a_output = normalize(b_norm_in, a_norm_in)
1302 
1303         # The test on b works for decimal=14 but the one for a does not. For
1304         # the sake of consistency, both of these are decimal=13. If something
1305         # breaks on another platform, it is probably fine to relax this lower.
1306         assert_array_almost_equal(b_matlab, b_output, decimal=13)
1307         assert_array_almost_equal(a_matlab, a_output, decimal=13)
1308 
1309     def test_errors(self):
1310         """Test the error cases."""
1311         # all zero denominator
1312         assert_raises(ValueError, normalize, [1, 2], 0)
1313 
1314         # denominator not 1 dimensional
1315         assert_raises(ValueError, normalize, [1, 2], [[1]])
1316 
1317         # numerator too many dimensions
1318         assert_raises(ValueError, normalize, [[[1, 2]]], 1)

1341 class TestLp2bp:
1342 
1343     def test_basic(self):
1344         b = [1]
1345         a = [1, 2, 2, 1]
1346         b_bp, a_bp = lp2bp(b, a, 2*np.pi*4000, 2*np.pi*2000)
1347         xp_assert_close(b_bp, [1.9844e12, 0, 0, 0], rtol=1e-6)
1348         xp_assert_close(a_bp, [1, 2.5133e4, 2.2108e9, 3.3735e13,
1349                                1.3965e18, 1.0028e22, 2.5202e26], rtol=1e-4)

1390 class TestLp2lp_zpk:
1391 
1392     def test_basic(self):
1393         z = []
1394         p = [(-1+1j)/np.sqrt(2), (-1-1j)/np.sqrt(2)]
1395         k = 1
1396         z_lp, p_lp, k_lp = lp2lp_zpk(z, p, k, 5)
1397         xp_assert_equal(z_lp, [])
1398         xp_assert_close(sort(p_lp), sort(p)*5)
1399         xp_assert_close(k_lp, 25.)
1400 
1401         # Pseudo-Chebyshev with both poles and zeros
1402         z = [-2j, +2j]
1403         p = [-0.75, -0.5-0.5j, -0.5+0.5j]
1404         k = 3
1405         z_lp, p_lp, k_lp = lp2lp_zpk(z, p, k, 20)
1406         xp_assert_close(sort(z_lp), sort([-40j, +40j]))
1407         xp_assert_close(sort(p_lp), sort([-15, -10-10j, -10+10j]))
1408         xp_assert_close(k_lp, 60.)
1409 
1410     def test_fs_validation(self):
1411         z = [-2j, +2j]
1412         p = [-0.75, -0.5 - 0.5j, -0.5 + 0.5j]
1413         k = 3
1414 
1415         with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Sampling.*single scalar"):
1416             bilinear_zpk(z, p, k, fs=np.array([10, 20]))
1417 
1418         with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Sampling.*be none"):
1419             bilinear_zpk(z, p, k, fs=None)

1500 class TestPrototypeType:
1501 
1502     def test_output_type(self):
1503         # Prototypes should consistently output arrays, not lists
1504         # https://github.com/scipy/scipy/pull/441
1505         for func in (buttap,
1506                      besselap,
1507                      lambda N: cheb1ap(N, 1),
1508                      lambda N: cheb2ap(N, 20),
1509                      lambda N: ellipap(N, 1, 20)):
1510             for N in range(7):
1511                 z, p, k = func(N)
1512                 assert isinstance(z, np.ndarray)
1513                 assert isinstance(p, np.ndarray)
1514 
1515 
1516 def dB(x):
1517     # Return magnitude in decibels, avoiding divide-by-zero warnings
1518     # (and deal with some "not less-ordered" errors when -inf shows up)
1519     return 20 * np.log10(np.maximum(np.abs(x), np.finfo(np.float64).tiny))
1520 
1521 
1522 class TestButtord:
1523 
1524     def test_lowpass(self):
1525         wp = 0.2
1526         ws = 0.3
1527         rp = 3
1528         rs = 60
1529         N, Wn = buttord(wp, ws, rp, rs, False)
1530         b, a = butter(N, Wn, 'lowpass', False)
1531         w, h = freqz(b, a)
1532         w /= np.pi
1533         assert np.all(-rp < dB(h[w <= wp]))
1534         assert np.all(dB(h[ws <= w]) < -rs)
1535 
1536         assert N == 16
1537         xp_assert_close(Wn,
1538                         2.0002776782743284e-01, rtol=1e-15)
1539 
1540     def test_highpass(self):
1541         wp = 0.3
1542         ws = 0.2
1543         rp = 3
1544         rs = 70
1545         N, Wn = buttord(wp, ws, rp, rs, False)
1546         b, a = butter(N, Wn, 'highpass', False)
1547         w, h = freqz(b, a)
1548         w /= np.pi
1549         assert np.all(-rp < dB(h[wp <= w]))
1550         assert np.all(dB(h[w <= ws]) < -rs)
1551 
1552         assert N == 18
1553         xp_assert_close(Wn,
1554                         2.9996603079132672e-01, rtol=1e-15)
1555 
1556     def test_bandpass(self):
1557         wp = [0.2, 0.5]
1558         ws = [0.1, 0.6]
1559         rp = 3
1560         rs = 80
1561         N, Wn = buttord(wp, ws, rp, rs, False)
1562         b, a = butter(N, Wn, 'bandpass', False)
1563         w, h = freqz(b, a)
1564         w /= np.pi
1565 
1566         assert np.all((-rp - 0.1) < dB(h[np.logical_and(wp[0] <= w, w <= wp[1])]))
1567 
1568         assert np.all(dB(h[np.logical_or(w <= ws[0], ws[1] <= w)]) < (-rs + 0.1))
1569 
1570         assert N == 18
1571         xp_assert_close(Wn, [1.9998742411409134e-01, 5.0002139595676276e-01],
1572                         rtol=1e-15)
1573 
1574     def test_bandstop(self):
1575         wp = [0.1, 0.6]
1576         ws = [0.2, 0.5]
1577         rp = 3
1578         rs = 90
1579         N, Wn = buttord(wp, ws, rp, rs, False)
1580         b, a = butter(N, Wn, 'bandstop', False)
1581         w, h = freqz(b, a)
1582         w /= np.pi
1583 
1584         assert np.all(-rp < dB(h[np.logical_or(w <= wp[0], wp[1] <= w)]))
1585         assert np.all(dB(h[np.logical_and(ws[0] <= w, w <= ws[1])]) < -rs)
1586 
1587         assert N == 20
1588         xp_assert_close(Wn, [1.4759432329294042e-01, 5.9997365985276407e-01],
1589                         rtol=1e-6)

1597         b, a = butter(N, Wn, 'lowpass', True)
1598         w, h = freqs(b, a)

1600         assert np.all(dB(h[ws <= w]) < -rs)

1851                         rtol=1e-6)

1928         assert np.all(dB(h[ws <= w]) < -rs + 0.1)

2052 class TestBessel:

2054     def test_degenerate(self):
2055         for norm in ('delay', 'phase', 'mag'):
2056             # 0-order filter is just a passthrough
2057             b, a = bessel(0, 1, analog=True, norm=norm)
2058             xp_assert_equal(b, np.asarray([1.0]))
2059             xp_assert_equal(a, np.asarray([1.0]))
2060 
2061             # 1-order filter is same for all types
2062             b, a = bessel(1, 1, analog=True, norm=norm)
2063             xp_assert_close(b, np.asarray([1.0]), rtol=1e-15)
2064             xp_assert_close(a, np.asarray([1.0, 1]), rtol=1e-15)
2065 
2066             z, p, k = bessel(1, 0.3, analog=True, output='zpk', norm=norm)
2067             xp_assert_equal(z, np.asarray([]))
2068             xp_assert_close(p, np.asarray([-0.3+0j]), rtol=1e-14)
2069             xp_assert_close(k, 0.3, rtol=1e-14)
2070

2161     def test_refs(self):
2162         # Compare to http://www.crbond.com/papers/bsf2.pdf
2163         # "Delay Normalized Bessel Polynomial Coefficients"
2164         bond_b = np.asarray([10395.0])

2166         b, a = bessel(6, 1, norm='delay', analog=True)
2167         xp_assert_close(b, bond_b)
2168         xp_assert_close(a, bond_a)
2169

2171         bond_poles = {
2172             1: [-1.0000000000],

2174             3: [-1.8389073227 + 1.7543809598j, -2.3221853546],

2194             p2 = np.sort(np.concatenate(_cplxreal(besselap(N, 'delay')[1])))
2195             assert_array_almost_equal(p1, p2, decimal=10)

2222             assert_array_almost_equal(p1, p2, decimal=10)
2223 
2224         # Compare to https://www.ranecommercial.com/legacy/note147.html
2225         # "Table 1 - Bessel Crossovers of Second, Third, and Fourth-Order"
2226         a = np.asarray([1, 1, 1/3])

2232         xp_assert_close(a[::-1], a2/b2)
2233

2235         b2, a2 = bessel(4, 1, norm='delay', analog=True)
2236         xp_assert_close(a[::-1], a2/b2)
2237 
2238         a = np.asarray([1, np.sqrt(3), 1])
2239         b2, a2 = bessel(2, 1, norm='phase', analog=True)
2240         xp_assert_close(a[::-1], a2/b2)
2241 
2242         # TODO: Why so inaccurate?  Is reference flawed?
2243         a = np.asarray([1, 2.481, 2.463, 1.018])
2244         b2, a2 = bessel(3, 1, norm='phase', analog=True)
2245         assert_array_almost_equal(a[::-1], a2/b2, decimal=1)
2246 
2247         # TODO: Why so inaccurate?  Is reference flawed?
2248         a = np.asarray([1, 3.240, 4.5, 3.240, 1.050])
2249         b2, a2 = bessel(4, 1, norm='phase', analog=True)
2250         assert_array_almost_equal(a[::-1], a2/b2, decimal=1)
2251 
2252         # Table of -3 dB factors:
2253         N, scale = 2, np.asarray([1.272, 1.272], dtype=np.complex128)
2254         scale2 = besselap(N, 'mag')[1] / besselap(N, 'phase')[1]
2255         assert_array_almost_equal(scale2, scale, decimal=3)
2256 
2257         # TODO: Why so inaccurate?  Is reference flawed?
2258         N, scale = 3, np.asarray([1.413, 1.413, 1.413], dtype=np.complex128)
2259         scale2 = besselap(N, 'mag')[1] / besselap(N, 'phase')[1]
2260         assert_array_almost_equal(scale2, scale, decimal=2)
2261 
2262         # TODO: Why so inaccurate?  Is reference flawed?
2263         N, scale = 4, np.asarray([1.533]*4, dtype=np.complex128)
2264         scale2 = besselap(N, 'mag')[1] / besselap(N, 'phase')[1]
2265         assert_array_almost_equal(scale, scale2, decimal=1)

2271             1: [-1],

2448     def test_norm_phase(self):
2449         # Test some orders and frequencies and see that they have the right
2450         # phase at w0
2451         for N in (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 51, 72):
2452             for w0 in (1, 100):
2453                 b, a = bessel(N, w0, analog=True, norm='phase')
2454                 w = np.linspace(0, w0, 100)
2455                 w, h = freqs(b, a, w)
2456                 phase = np.unwrap(np.angle(h))
2457                 xp_assert_close(phase[[0, -1]], (0, -N*pi/4), rtol=1e-1)
2458 
2459     def test_norm_mag(self):
2460         # Test some orders and frequencies and see that they have the right
2461         # mag at w0
2462         for N in (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 51, 72):
2463             for w0 in (1, 100):
2464                 b, a = bessel(N, w0, analog=True, norm='mag')
2465                 w = (0, w0)
2466                 w, h = freqs(b, a, w)
2467                 mag = abs(h)
2468                 xp_assert_close(mag, (1, 1/np.sqrt(2)))
2469 
2470     def test_norm_delay(self):
2471         # Test some orders and frequencies and see that they have the right
2472         # delay at DC
2473         for N in (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 51, 72):
2474             for w0 in (1, 100):
2475                 b, a = bessel(N, w0, analog=True, norm='delay')
2476                 w = np.linspace(0, 10*w0, 1000)
2477                 w, h = freqs(b, a, w)
2478                 delay = -np.diff(np.unwrap(np.angle(h)))/np.diff(w)
2479                 xp_assert_close(delay[0], 1/w0, rtol=1e-4)
2480

2482         mpmath_values = {

2508     def test_invalid(self):
2509         assert_raises(ValueError, besselap, 5, 'nonsense')
2510         assert_raises(ValueError, besselap, -5)
2511         assert_raises(ValueError, besselap, 3.2)
2512         assert_raises(ValueError, _bessel_poly, -3)
2513         assert_raises(ValueError, _bessel_poly, 3.3)

2515     @pytest.mark.fail_slow(10)
2516     def test_fs_param(self):
2517         for norm in ('phase', 'mag', 'delay'):
2518             for fs in (900, 900.1, 1234.567):
2519                 for N in (0, 1, 2, 3, 10):
2520                     for fc in (100, 100.1, 432.12345):
2521                         for btype in ('lp', 'hp'):
2522                             ba1 = bessel(N, fc, btype, norm=norm, fs=fs)
2523                             ba2 = bessel(N, fc/(fs/2), btype, norm=norm)
2524                             for ba1_, ba2_ in zip(ba1, ba2):
2525                                 xp_assert_close(ba1_, ba2_)
2526                     for fc in ((100, 200), (100.1, 200.2), (321.123, 432.123)):
2527                         for btype in ('bp', 'bs'):
2528                             ba1 = bessel(N, fc, btype, norm=norm, fs=fs)
2529                             for seq in (list, tuple, array):
2530                                 fcnorm = seq([f/(fs/2) for f in fc])
2531                                 ba2 = bessel(N, fcnorm, btype, norm=norm)
2532                                 for ba1_, ba2_ in zip(ba1, ba2):
2533                                     xp_assert_close(ba1_, ba2_)

2535 
2536 class TestButter:
2537 
2538     def test_degenerate(self):
2539         # 0-order filter is just a passthrough
2540         b, a = butter(0, 1, analog=True)
2541         xp_assert_equal(b, np.asarray([1.0]))
2542         xp_assert_equal(a, np.asarray([1.0]))
2543 
2544         # 1-order filter is same for all types
2545         b, a = butter(1, 1, analog=True)
2546         assert_array_almost_equal(b, [1])
2547         assert_array_almost_equal(a, [1, 1])
2548 
2549         z, p, k = butter(1, 0.3, output='zpk')
2550         xp_assert_equal(z, np.asarray([-1.0]))
2551         xp_assert_close(p, [3.249196962329063e-01 + 0j], rtol=1e-14)
2552         xp_assert_close(k, 3.375401518835469e-01, rtol=1e-14)
2553 
2554     def test_basic(self):
2555         # analog s-plane
2556         for N in range(25):
2557             wn = 0.01
2558             z, p, k = butter(N, wn, 'low', analog=True, output='zpk')
2559             assert_array_almost_equal([], z)
2560             assert len(p) == N
2561             # All poles should be at distance wn from origin
2562             assert_array_almost_equal(abs(p), np.asarray(wn))
2563             assert all(np.real(p) <= 0)  # No poles in right half of S-plane
2564             assert_array_almost_equal(wn**N, k)
2565 
2566         # digital z-plane
2567         for N in range(25):
2568             wn = 0.01
2569             z, p, k = butter(N, wn, 'high', analog=False, output='zpk')
2570             xp_assert_equal(np.ones(N), z)  # All zeros exactly at DC
2571             assert all(np.abs(p) <= 1)  # No poles outside unit circle
2572 
2573         b1, a1 = butter(2, 1, analog=True)
2574         assert_array_almost_equal(b1, [1])
2575         assert_array_almost_equal(a1, [1, np.sqrt(2), 1])
2576 
2577         b2, a2 = butter(5, 1, analog=True)
2578         assert_array_almost_equal(b2, [1])
2579         assert_array_almost_equal(a2, [1, 3.2361, 5.2361,
2580                                        5.2361, 3.2361, 1], decimal=4)
2581 
2582         b3, a3 = butter(10, 1, analog=True)
2583         assert_array_almost_equal(b3, [1])
2584         assert_array_almost_equal(a3, [1, 6.3925, 20.4317, 42.8021, 64.8824,
2585                                        74.2334, 64.8824, 42.8021, 20.4317,
2586                                        6.3925, 1], decimal=4)
2587 
2588         b2, a2 = butter(19, 1.0441379169150726, analog=True)
2589         assert_array_almost_equal(b2, [2.2720], decimal=4)
2590         assert_array_almost_equal(a2, 1.0e+004 * np.array([
2591                         0.0001, 0.0013, 0.0080, 0.0335, 0.1045, 0.2570,
2592                         0.5164, 0.8669, 1.2338, 1.5010, 1.5672, 1.4044,
2593                         1.0759, 0.6986, 0.3791, 0.1681, 0.0588, 0.0153,
2594                         0.0026, 0.0002]), decimal=0)

2775     def test_fs_param(self):
2776         for fs in (900, 900.1, 1234.567):
2777             for N in (0, 1, 2, 3, 10):
2778                 for fc in (100, 100.1, 432.12345):
2779                     for btype in ('lp', 'hp'):
2780                         ba1 = butter(N, fc, btype, fs=fs)
2781                         ba2 = butter(N, fc/(fs/2), btype)
2782                         for ba1_, ba2_ in zip(ba1, ba2):
2783                             xp_assert_close(ba1_, ba2_)
2784                 for fc in ((100, 200), (100.1, 200.2), (321.123, 432.123)):
2785                     for btype in ('bp', 'bs'):
2786                         ba1 = butter(N, fc, btype, fs=fs)
2787                         for seq in (list, tuple, array):
2788                             fcnorm = seq([f/(fs/2) for f in fc])
2789                             ba2 = butter(N, fcnorm, btype)
2790                             for ba1_, ba2_ in zip(ba1, ba2):
2791                                 xp_assert_close(ba1_, ba2_)

2796     def test_degenerate(self):
2797         # 0-order filter is just a passthrough
2798         # Even-order filters have DC gain of -rp dB
2799         b, a = cheby1(0, 10*np.log10(2), 1, analog=True)
2800         assert_array_almost_equal(b, [1/np.sqrt(2)])
2801         xp_assert_equal(a, np.asarray([1.0]))
2802 
2803         # 1-order filter is same for all types
2804         b, a = cheby1(1, 10*np.log10(2), 1, analog=True)
2805         assert_array_almost_equal(b, [1])
2806         assert_array_almost_equal(a, [1, 1])
2807 
2808         z, p, k = cheby1(1, 0.1, 0.3, output='zpk')
2809         xp_assert_equal(z, np.asarray([-1.0]))
2810         xp_assert_close(p, [-5.390126972799615e-01 + 0j], rtol=1e-14)
2811         xp_assert_close(k, 7.695063486399808e-01, rtol=1e-14)
2812 
2813     def test_basic(self):
2814         for N in range(25):
2815             wn = 0.01
2816             z, p, k = cheby1(N, 1, wn, 'low', analog=True, output='zpk')
2817             assert_array_almost_equal([], z)
2818             assert len(p) == N
2819             assert all(np.real(p) <= 0)  # No poles in right half of S-plane
2820 
2821         for N in range(25):
2822             wn = 0.01
2823             z, p, k = cheby1(N, 1, wn, 'high', analog=False, output='zpk')
2824             xp_assert_equal(np.ones(N), z)  # All zeros exactly at DC
2825             assert all(np.abs(p) <= 1)  # No poles outside unit circle
2826 
2827         # Same test as TestNormalize

3044     def test_fs_param(self):
3045         for fs in (900, 900.1, 1234.567):
3046             for N in (0, 1, 2, 3, 10):
3047                 for fc in (100, 100.1, 432.12345):
3048                     for btype in ('lp', 'hp'):
3049                         ba1 = cheby1(N, 1, fc, btype, fs=fs)
3050                         ba2 = cheby1(N, 1, fc/(fs/2), btype)
3051                         for ba1_, ba2_ in zip(ba1, ba2):
3052                             xp_assert_close(ba1_, ba2_)
3053                 for fc in ((100, 200), (100.1, 200.2), (321.123, 432.123)):
3054                     for btype in ('bp', 'bs'):
3055                         ba1 = cheby1(N, 1, fc, btype, fs=fs)
3056                         for seq in (list, tuple, array):
3057                             fcnorm = seq([f/(fs/2) for f in fc])
3058                             ba2 = cheby1(N, 1, fcnorm, btype)
3059                             for ba1_, ba2_ in zip(ba1, ba2):
3060                                 xp_assert_close(ba1_, ba2_)
3061 
3062 class TestCheby2:
3063 
3064     def test_degenerate(self):
3065         # 0-order filter is just a passthrough
3066         # Stopband ripple factor doesn't matter
3067         b, a = cheby2(0, 123.456, 1, analog=True)
3068         xp_assert_equal(b, np.asarray([1.0]))
3069         xp_assert_equal(a, np.asarray([1.0]))
3070 
3071         # 1-order filter is same for all types
3072         b, a = cheby2(1, 10*np.log10(2), 1, analog=True)
3073         assert_array_almost_equal(b, [1])
3074         assert_array_almost_equal(a, [1, 1])
3075 
3076         z, p, k = cheby2(1, 50, 0.3, output='zpk')
3077         xp_assert_equal(z, np.asarray([-1], dtype=np.complex128))
3078         xp_assert_close(p, [9.967826460175649e-01 + 0j], rtol=1e-14)
3079         xp_assert_close(k, 1.608676991217512e-03, rtol=1e-14)
3080 
3081     def test_basic(self):
3082         for N in range(25):
3083             wn = 0.01
3084             z, p, k = cheby2(N, 40, wn, 'low', analog=True, output='zpk')
3085             assert len(p) == N
3086             assert all(np.real(p) <= 0)  # No poles in right half of S-plane
3087 
3088         for N in range(25):
3089             wn = 0.01
3090             z, p, k = cheby2(N, 40, wn, 'high', analog=False, output='zpk')
3091             assert all(np.abs(p) <= 1)  # No poles outside unit circle
3092 
3093         B, A = cheby2(18, 100, 0.5)
3094         assert_array_almost_equal(B, [

3328     def test_fs_param(self):
3329         for fs in (900, 900.1, 1234.567):
3330             for N in (0, 1, 2, 3, 10):
3331                 for fc in (100, 100.1, 432.12345):
3332                     for btype in ('lp', 'hp'):
3333                         ba1 = cheby2(N, 20, fc, btype, fs=fs)
3334                         ba2 = cheby2(N, 20, fc/(fs/2), btype)
3335                         for ba1_, ba2_ in zip(ba1, ba2):
3336                             xp_assert_close(ba1_, ba2_)
3337                 for fc in ((100, 200), (100.1, 200.2), (321.123, 432.123)):
3338                     for btype in ('bp', 'bs'):
3339                         ba1 = cheby2(N, 20, fc, btype, fs=fs)
3340                         for seq in (list, tuple, array):
3341                             fcnorm = seq([f/(fs/2) for f in fc])
3342                             ba2 = cheby2(N, 20, fcnorm, btype)
3343                             for ba1_, ba2_ in zip(ba1, ba2):
3344                                 xp_assert_close(ba1_, ba2_)

3346 class TestEllip:
3347 
3348     def test_degenerate(self):
3349         # 0-order filter is just a passthrough
3350         # Even-order filters have DC gain of -rp dB
3351         # Stopband ripple factor doesn't matter
3352         b, a = ellip(0, 10*np.log10(2), 123.456, 1, analog=True)
3353         assert_array_almost_equal(b, [1/np.sqrt(2)])
3354         xp_assert_equal(a, np.asarray([1.0]))
3355 
3356         # 1-order filter is same for all types
3357         b, a = ellip(1, 10*np.log10(2), 1, 1, analog=True)
3358         assert_array_almost_equal(b, [1])
3359         assert_array_almost_equal(a, [1, 1])
3360 
3361         z, p, k = ellip(1, 1, 55, 0.3, output='zpk')
3362         xp_assert_close(z, [-9.999999999999998e-01], rtol=1e-14)
3363         xp_assert_close(p, [-6.660721153525525e-04], rtol=1e-10)
3364         xp_assert_close(k, 5.003330360576763e-01, rtol=1e-14)
3365 
3366     def test_basic(self):
3367         for N in range(25):
3368             wn = 0.01
3369             z, p, k = ellip(N, 1, 40, wn, 'low', analog=True, output='zpk')
3370             assert len(p) == N
3371             assert all(np.real(p) <= 0)  # No poles in right half of S-plane
3372 
3373         for N in range(25):
3374             wn = 0.01
3375             z, p, k = ellip(N, 1, 40, wn, 'high', analog=False, output='zpk')
3376             assert all(np.abs(p) <= 1)  # No poles outside unit circle
3377 
3378         b3, a3 = ellip(5, 3, 26, 1, analog=True)
3379         assert_array_almost_equal(b3, [0.1420, 0, 0.3764, 0,
3380                                        0.2409], decimal=4)
3381         assert_array_almost_equal(a3, [1, 0.5686, 1.8061, 0.8017, 0.8012,
3382                                        0.2409], decimal=4)
3383 
3384         b, a = ellip(3, 1, 60, [0.4, 0.7], 'stop')
3385         assert_array_almost_equal(b, [0.3310, 0.3469, 1.1042, 0.7044, 1.1042,
3386                                       0.3469, 0.3310], decimal=4)
3387         assert_array_almost_equal(a, [1.0000, 0.6973, 1.1441, 0.5878, 0.7323,
3388                                       0.1131, -0.0060], decimal=4)

3631     def test_fs_param(self):
3632         for fs in (900, 900.1, 1234.567):
3633             for N in (0, 1, 2, 3, 10):
3634                 for fc in (100, 100.1, 432.12345):
3635                     for btype in ('lp', 'hp'):
3636                         ba1 = ellip(N, 1, 20, fc, btype, fs=fs)
3637                         ba2 = ellip(N, 1, 20, fc/(fs/2), btype)
3638                         for ba1_, ba2_ in zip(ba1, ba2):
3639                             xp_assert_close(ba1_, ba2_)
3640                 for fc in ((100, 200), (100.1, 200.2), (321.123, 432.123)):
3641                     for btype in ('bp', 'bs'):
3642                         ba1 = ellip(N, 1, 20, fc, btype, fs=fs)
3643                         for seq in (list, tuple, array):
3644                             fcnorm = seq([f/(fs/2) for f in fc])
3645                             ba2 = ellip(N, 1, 20, fcnorm, btype)
3646                             for ba1_, ba2_ in zip(ba1, ba2):
3647                                 xp_assert_close(ba1_, ba2_)

3656 
3657 def test_sos_consistency():
3658     # Consistency checks of output='sos' for the specialized IIR filter
3659     # design functions.
3660     design_funcs = [(bessel, (0.1,)),
3661                     (butter, (0.1,)),
3662                     (cheby1, (45.0, 0.1)),
3663                     (cheby2, (0.087, 0.1)),
3664                     (ellip, (0.087, 45, 0.1))]
3665     for func, args in design_funcs:
3666         name = func.__name__
3667 
3668         b, a = func(2, *args, output='ba')
3669         sos = func(2, *args, output='sos')
3670         xp_assert_close(sos, [np.hstack((b, a))], err_msg=f"{name}(2,...)")
3671 
3672         zpk = func(3, *args, output='zpk')
3673         sos = func(3, *args, output='sos')
3674         xp_assert_close(sos, zpk2sos(*zpk), err_msg=f"{name}(3,...)")
3675 
3676         zpk = func(4, *args, output='zpk')
3677         sos = func(4, *args, output='sos')
3678         xp_assert_close(sos, zpk2sos(*zpk), err_msg=f"{name}(4,...)")

3692              1.0000000e+00, -1.9584219e+00,
3693              9.9373647e-01

3699     def test_frequency_response(self):
3700         # Get filter coefficients
3701         b, a = iirnotch(0.3, 30)
3702 
3703         # Get frequency response
3704         w, h = freqz(b, a, 1000)
3705 
3706         # Pick 5 point
3707         p = [200,  # w0 = 0.200
3708              295,  # w0 = 0.295
3709              300,  # w0 = 0.300
3710              305,  # w0 = 0.305
3711              400]  # w0 = 0.400
3712 
3713         # Get frequency response correspondent to each of those points
3714         hp = h[p]
3715 
3716         # Check if the frequency response fulfill the specifications:
3717         # hp[0] and hp[4]  correspond to frequencies distant from
3718         # w0 = 0.3 and should be close to 1
3719         xp_assert_close(abs(hp[0]), np.asarray(1.), rtol=1e-2, check_0d=False)
3720         xp_assert_close(abs(hp[4]), np.asarray(1.), rtol=1e-2, check_0d=False)
3721 
3722         # hp[1] and hp[3] correspond to frequencies approximately
3723         # on the edges of the passband and should be close to -3dB
3724         xp_assert_close(abs(hp[1]), 1/np.sqrt(2), rtol=1e-2)
3725         xp_assert_close(abs(hp[3]), 1/np.sqrt(2), rtol=1e-2)
3726 
3727         # hp[2] correspond to the frequency that should be removed
3728         # the frequency response should be very close to 0
3729         xp_assert_close(abs(hp[2]), np.asarray(0.0), atol=1e-10, check_0d=False)
3730 
3731     def test_errors(self):
3732         # Exception should be raised if w0 > 1 or w0 <0
3733         assert_raises(ValueError, iirnotch, w0=2, Q=30)
3734         assert_raises(ValueError, iirnotch, w0=-1, Q=30)
3735 
3736         # Exception should be raised if any of the parameters
3737         # are not float (or cannot be converted to one)
3738         assert_raises(ValueError, iirnotch, w0="blabla", Q=30)
3739         assert_raises(TypeError, iirnotch, w0=-1, Q=[1, 2, 3])
3740 
3741     def test_fs_param(self):
3742         # Get filter coefficients
3743         b, a = iirnotch(1500, 30, fs=10000)
3744 
3745         # Get frequency response
3746         w, h = freqz(b, a, 1000, fs=10000)
3747 
3748         # Pick 5 point
3749         p = [200,  # w0 = 1000
3750              295,  # w0 = 1475
3751              300,  # w0 = 1500
3752              305,  # w0 = 1525
3753              400]  # w0 = 2000
3754 
3755         # Get frequency response correspondent to each of those points
3756         hp = h[p]
3757 
3758         # Check if the frequency response fulfill the specifications:
3759         # hp[0] and hp[4]  correspond to frequencies distant from
3760         # w0 = 1500 and should be close to 1
3761         xp_assert_close(abs(hp[0]), np.ones_like(abs(hp[0])), rtol=1e-2,
3762                         check_0d=False)
3763         xp_assert_close(abs(hp[4]), np.ones_like(abs(hp[4])), rtol=1e-2,
3764                         check_0d=False)
3765 
3766         # hp[1] and hp[3] correspond to frequencies approximately
3767         # on the edges of the passband and should be close to -3dB
3768         xp_assert_close(abs(hp[1]), 1/np.sqrt(2), rtol=1e-2)
3769         xp_assert_close(abs(hp[3]), 1/np.sqrt(2), rtol=1e-2)
3770 
3771         # hp[2] correspond to the frequency that should be removed
3772         # the frequency response should be very close to 0
3773         xp_assert_close(abs(hp[2]), np.asarray(0.0), atol=1e-10, check_0d=False)

3793     def test_frequency_response(self):

3795         b, a = iirpeak(0.3, 30)
3796 
3797         # Get frequency response
3798         w, h = freqz(b, a, 1000)
3799 
3800         # Pick 5 point
3801         p = [30,  # w0 = 0.030
3802              295,  # w0 = 0.295
3803              300,  # w0 = 0.300
3804              305,  # w0 = 0.305
3805              800]  # w0 = 0.800
3806 
3807         # Get frequency response correspondent to each of those points
3808         hp = h[p]
3809

3822 
3823         # hp[2] correspond to the frequency that should be retained and
3824         # the frequency response should be very close to 1
3825         xp_assert_close(abs(hp[2]), np.asarray(1.0), rtol=1e-10, check_0d=False)
